column6: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: TechnologyOne takes a zero-tolerance approach to bribery and corruption, so breaches of this policy will be handled seriously. They may result in termination of employment if an Employee is found to have contravened this policy. This policy will be reviewed annually.
column20: Anti-bribery Policy, Policy Enforcement, Compliance Review

column13: TechnologyOne is conservative in its approach to tax risk. TechnologyOne aims to comply with tax obligations in each jurisdiction it operates fully. By its commitment to best-practice corporate governance and a culture of excellence, TechnologyOne will not enter into any arrangements that may be considered tax evasion. \t
column20: Tax Compliance, Best-practice Governance, Tax Evasion Prevention

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: The Tax Risk Governance Policy includes a framework for the internal escalation process for referring matters to the CFO. The CFO must report any material tax issues to the Board. TechnologyOne will not pursue aggressive tax positions or strategies or adopt positions that cannot be supported or defended in a court of law. Advice is obtained when the tax law is unclear or subject to interpretation. When necessary, the Australian Taxation Office (ATO) (or other relevant tax authority) is consulted to ensure certainty.
column20: Tax Risk Governance, Internal Framework, Reporting Structure

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: TechnologyOne has a tax governance framework, which the Board has approved. The tax falls under the oversight of the Audit and Risk Committee.
column20: Tax Governance Framework, Board Oversight, Audit Committee Involvement

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: TechnologyOne has a robust compliance history and an open engagement with relevant tax authorities. We seek to be cooperative and transparent and to maintain collaborative relationships.

TechnologyOne has an Advanced Pricing Arrangement (APA) with the Australian Taxation Office. Our engagement with the ATO through the APA process seeks to ensure Australia receives a commercial return for using intellectual property by our overseas businesses. These returns are taxable in Australia.

column13: The wind power project aims to develop enough power to replace existing coal-fired power plants. As well as providing a source of clean energy, the project improves the overall wellbeing of local communities by providing employment, clean water and sanitation, improved agricultural techniques, and opportunities for everyone - including women and youth.

column7: The highest proportion of our emissions come from third-party services. We're ramping up our plans to reduce carbon emissions and have invested in certified carbon offset credits to counteract the remaining emissions after our reductions.
Our total global operational emissions for FY23 amounted to 8,465 tCO2 -e, an increase against FY22, primarily attributed to resuming global travel (flights) and increasing our technology investment.

column13: TechnologyOne's global operations are carbon neutral. In FY20 and FY21, we achieved Climate Active certification for our Australian operations; in FY22, we expanded our certification to include our global operations. We apply for Climate Active certification annually in arrears in October. In FY23, our certification for FY22 was maintained, and we'll report on the outcome of our FY23 certification in our FY24 Sustainability Report.
column20: Carbon Neutrality, Climate Active Certification, Sustainability Reporting
